snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin signed a law on Tuesday that could roll back a reform, pushed by his predecessor, that allows the direct election of regional governors.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin signs law allowing regional legislatures to forgo elections and appoint governors from list of candidates approved by Putin; critics say law would allow pro-Kremlin United Russia Party to avoid election defeats by using its control of regional legislatures to bypass popular voting.
lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin signed a law on Tuesday that could roll back a reform, pushed by his predecessor, that allows the direct election of regional governors.

headline.seo: Russia: New Law Allows Governors to Be Appointed, Undoing Reform
headline.main: Russia: New Law Allows Governors to Be Appointed, Undoing Reform
headline.print_headline: Russia: New Law Allows Governors To Be Appointed, Undoing Reform
